lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia gave Iranian diplomats 48 hours to leave the kingdom as the two powers exchanged heated words after the Saudis executed a prominent Shiite cleric.

byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim contributed reporting from Cairo, David E. Sanger from Washington, and Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran.

headline.print_headline: Saudis Cutting Ties to Iranians as Tension Rises
headline.main: Saudi Arabia Cuts Ties With Iran Amid Fallout From Cleric’s Execution

snippet: Saudi Arabia gave Iranian diplomats 48 hours to leave the kingdom as the two powers exchanged heated words after the Saudis executed a prominent Shiite cleric.
abstract: Saudi Arabia cuts diplomatic relations with Iran and tells Iranian diplomats to leave kingdom in 48 hours; move comes in wake of harsh criticism made by Iranian officials of Saudi execution of Shiite cleric Sheikh Nimr al-Nimr, which led to storming of Saudi Embassy in Tehran by protesters.
